column4: what are the names of the kernels in edgy? i can't find a SMP kernel for my AMD 2x CPU :(
I think the default kernel has SMP support
model name      : AMD Athlon(tm) 64 X2 Dual Core Processor 3800+  only one...
do cat /proc/cpuinfo | less and see how many processors it shows
already did that : one
are you running dapper or edgy?
edgy (dist-upgraded from dapper)
did you have smp support in dapper?
i installed this linux-k7-smp and got 2 cpus... but no grahpics because my nvidia driver is for the edgy kernel
yes...
yeah I think you need to switch to the generic edgy kernel
what is its name?
http://www.mathbin.net/2536
err
linux-image-2.6.17-10-generic
already installed... i think its the one I have installed Linux maia 2.6.17-10-386 #2 Tue Dec 5 22:26:18 UTC 2006 i686 GNU/Linux
well the generic kernel does have smp support, you just need to make it the default kernel in /boot/grub/menu.lst
i think its the dapper 2 edgy upgrade fault... (passed from 3/4 failure to 4/4 failure) :(
Its the running kernel (i ran uname -a)
and it only shows one cpu in /proc/cpuinfo?
yes
I'm not sure what the deal is, sorry
thanks anyway
